cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north-northwest then northwest, tracking through the Bahamas and paralleling the southeast coast of Florida toward the northern peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: close pass or landfall along Florida’s southeast coast near Broward-Palm Beach counties

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet to Flagler/Volusia county line (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach to Sebastian Inlet, including Port Everglades area and Lake Okeechobee (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast from Miami-Dade through the Space Coast, plus the Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions (sustained 75–100+ mph with higher gusts) possible late Thu into early Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4+ ft inundation possible with large battering waves along the port entrance and intracoastal waterways
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches, isolated totals near 10 inches, producing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas, breaking surf, rip currents, and the potential for isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands
